benchmark_details.name: XOR-TYDIQA
benchmark_details.overview: XOR-TYDIQA is a large-scale dataset that consists of 40,000 information-seeking questions across 7 diverse non-English languages, aimed at facilitating the task of cross-lingual open-retrieval question answering.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To support research in cross-lingual open-retrieval question answering by providing a dataset that helps address information scarcity in multilingual contexts.

data.source: Annotated questions and answers collected from TYDIQA and crowdsourced annotation from native speakers.
data.annotation: Cross-lingual retrieval facilitated by professional translators and crowdsourced native speaker annotators.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the agreement between predicted answers and ground truth annotations.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better model performance in retrieving and answering questions accurately.
methodology.baseline_results: The best baseline achieves an average of 18.7 F1 points on the XOR-FULL task.
methodology.validation: Models were validated using question-answer pairs in the dataset.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: The dataset includes questions from native speakers of diverse languages, aiming to mitigate bias in QA systems.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: Crowdworkers consented to have their responses used in this way through the Amazon Mechanical Turk Participation Agreement.
